about.title: About me
about.paragraph1: Hello! I'm a software developer focused on .NET with hands-on experience building and evolving production systems. I enjoy working on solutions that solve real problems, always prioritizing clean code, well-thought-out architecture, and concrete impact for users.
about.paragraph2: My programming journey started from my interest in modding and developing games, which led me to study Game Design. It was during this process that I discovered software development went far beyond games, and that creating well-structured, scalable, and efficient systems was something that truly motivated me.
about.paragraph3: Currently, I work at Teleperformance, developing and maintaining .NET applications used by thousands of users. I work both on creating new features and on maintaining and modernizing legacy systems, as well as API integrations and participating in technical decisions focused on scalability, performance, and maintainability.
about.paragraph4: I'm a tech enthusiast who loves understanding how things work under the hood. That's why, beyond professional development, I'm interested in infrastructure, automation, and homelab experiments, always seeking to deepen my technical knowledge and apply best practices that make software more reliable and sustainable over time.

skills.backend: C#, .NET Framework, .NET Core / .NET, ASP.NET Core (Web API), Entity Framework, Entity Framework Core, REST APIs, microservices, system integration.
skills.database: SQL Server, data modeling, SQL queries and optimization.
skills.tools: Git, GitLab, Docker, Linux, Nginx, Cloudflare, homelab (self-hosting, automation and services), Swagger / OpenAPI, Jira, Postman, API integration and consumption, clean code and best practices.
